text: sheldon_cooper I 've been thinking about time travel again .
leonard_hofstadter Why , did you hit a roadblock with invisibility ?

sheldon_cooper Put it on the back burner . Anyway , it occurs to me , if I ever did perfect a time machine , I 'd just go into the past and give it to myself , thus eliminating the need for me to invent it in the first place .
leonard_hofstadter Interesting .
sheldon_cooper Yeah , it really takes the pressure off .
leonard_hofstadter Sounds like a breakthrough , should I call the science magazines and tell them to hold the front cover ?
sheldon_cooper It 's time travel , Leonard , I will have already done that .
leonard_hofstadter Then I guess congratulations are in order .
sheldon_cooper No , congratulations will have been in order . You know , I 'm not going to enjoy this party .
leonard_hofstadter I know , I 'm familiar with you .
sheldon_cooper At the last department party , Dr Finkleday cornered me and talked about spelunking for 45 minutes .
leonard_hofstadter Yes , I was there .
sheldon_cooper You know what 's interesting about caves , Leonard ?
leonard_hofstadter What ?
sheldon_cooper Nothing .
leonard_hofstadter Well then we 'll avoid Finkleday , we 'll meet the new department head , congratulate him , shake his hand and go .

sheldon_cooper How 's this ? Pleased to meet you , Dr Gablehouser . How fortunate for you that the University has chosen to hire you , despite the fact that you 've done no original research in 25 years , and instead have written a series of popular books that reduce the great concepts of science to a series of anecdotes , each one dumbed down to accommodate the duration of an average bowel movement . Mahalo .
leonard_hofstadter Mahalo 's a nice touch .
sheldon_cooper Do you know there are only eight consonants in the Hawaiian language .
leonard_hofstadter Interesting , you should lead with that .
raj_koothrappali Oh , God , Look at this buffet . I love America .
leonard_hofstadter You do n't have buffets in India ?
raj_koothrappali Of course , but it 's all Indian food . You ca n't find a bagel in Mumbai to save your life . Schmear me .
sheldon_cooper Well here 's an interesting turn of events .
leonard_hofstadter What . Howard brought a date ?
sheldon_cooper A more plausible explanation is that his work in robotics has made an amazing leap forward .
howard_wolowitz Hey , what up , science bitches ? May I introduce my special lady friend , Summer .
summer I already told you , touching 's extra .
howard_wolowitz Right . Sorry .
leonard_hofstadter Here comes our new boss , be polite .
dr_eric_gablehauser Hi fellas , Eric Gablehouser .
howard_wolowitz Howard Wolowitz .
dr_eric_gablehauser Howard , nice to meet you , and you are ?
sheldon_cooper An actual real scientist . How was that ?
sheldon_cooper I ca n't believe he fired me .
leonard_hofstadter Well , you did call him a glorified high - school science teacher whose last successful experiment was lighting his own farts .
sheldon_cooper In my defence , I prefaced that by saying ' with all due respect . '
leonard_hofstadter Morning .
sheldon_cooper Morning .
leonard_hofstadter You 're making eggs for breakfast ?
sheldon_cooper This is n't breakfast , it 's an experiment .
leonard_hofstadter Huh ? Cos it looks a lot like breakfast .
sheldon_cooper I finally have the time to test my hypothesis , about the separation of the water molecules from the egg proteins , and its impact vis - a - vis taste .
leonard_hofstadter Sounds yummy . I look forward to your work with bacon .
sheldon_cooper As do I.
leonard_hofstadter You know , I 'm sure if you just apologized to Gablehauser he would give you your job back .

sheldon_cooper I do n't want my job back . I 've spent the last three and a half years staring at greaseboards full of equations . Before that I spent four years working on my thesis . Before that I was in college , and before that , I was in the fifth grade . This is my first day off in decades , and I 'm going to savour it .
leonard_hofstadter Okay . I 'll let you get back to fixing your eggs .
sheldon_cooper I 'm not just fixing my eggs , I 'm fixing everyone 's eggs .
leonard_hofstadter And we all thank you .
sheldon_cooper Use new eggs .
penny Hi , hey . I 'm running out to the market , do you guys need anything ?
sheldon_cooper Oh , well this would be one of those circumstances that people unfamiliar with the law of large numbers would call a coincidence .
penny I 'm sorry ?
sheldon_cooper I need eggs . Four dozen should suffice .
penny Four dozen ?
sheldon_cooper Yes , and evenly distributed amongst brown , white , free range , large , extra - large and jumbo .
penny Okay , one more time ?
sheldon_cooper Never mind , you wo n't get it right , I 'd better come with you .
penny Oh , yay !
penny How come you did n't go into work today .
sheldon_cooper I 'm taking a sabbatical , because I wo n't kow - tow to mediocre minds .
penny So you got canned , huh ?
sheldon_cooper Theoretical physicists do not get canned . But yeah .
penny Well , maybe it 's all for the best , you know I always say , when one door closes , another one opens .
sheldon_cooper No it does n't . Not unless the two doors are connected by relays , or there are motion sensors involved .
penny No , no , I meant ... .
sheldon_cooper Or the first door closing causes a change of air pressure that acts upon the second door .
penny Never mind .
sheldon_cooper Slow down . Slow down , please slow down .
penny We 're fine .
sheldon_cooper Look , you 're not leaving yourself enough space between cars .
penny Oh , sure I am .
sheldon_cooper No , no . Let me do the math for you , this car weighs let 's say 4,000 lb , now add say 140 for me , 120 for you .
penny 120 ?
sheldon_cooper Oh , I 'm sorry , did I insult you ? Is your body mass somehow tied into your self worth ?
penny Well , yeah .
sheldon_cooper Interesting . Anyway , that gives us a total weight of , let 's say , 4,400 lb .
penny Let 's say 4,390 .

sheldon_cooper Fine . We 're travelling forward at , good Lord , 51 miles an hour . Now let 's assume that your brakes are new and the callipers are aligned , still , by the time we come to a stop , we 'll be occupying the same space as that Buick in front of us , an impossibility that nature will quickly resolve into death , mutilation and ... oh look , they built a new put - put course .
sheldon_cooper This is great . Look at me , out in the real world of ordinary people , just living their ordinary , colourless , workaday lives .
penny Thank you .
sheldon_cooper No , thank you . And thank you , ordinary person . Hey , you want to hear an interesting thing about tomatoes .
penny Uh , no , no not really . Listen , did n't you say you needed some eggs .
sheldon_cooper Uh , yes , but anyone who knows anything about the dynamics of bacterial growth knows to pick up their refrigerated foods on the way out of the supermarket .
penny Oh , okay , well maybe you should start heading on out then .
sheldon_cooper No , this is fun . Oh , the thing about tomatoes , and I think you 'll really enjoy this , is , they 're shelved with the vegetables , but they 're technically a fruit .
penny Interesting .
sheldon_cooper Is n't it ?
penny No , I mean what you find enjoyable .
sheldon_cooper Oh boy .
penny What now ?
sheldon_cooper Well , there 's some value to taking a multivitamin , but the human body can only absorb so much , what you 're buying here are the ingredients for very expensive urine .
penny Well , maybe that 's what I was going for .
sheldon_cooper Well then you 'll want some manganese .
sheldon_cooper That was fun . Maybe tomorrow we can go to one of those big warehouse stores .
penny Oh , I do n't know Sheldon , it 's going to take me a while to recover from all the fun I had today .
sheldon_cooper Are you sure . There are a lot of advantages to buying in bulk . For example , I noticed that you purchase your tampons one month 's supply at a time .
penny What ?
sheldon_cooper Well think about it , it 's a product that does n't spoil , and you 're going to be needing them for at least the next thirty years .
penny You want me to buy thirty years worth of tampons ?
sheldon_cooper Well , thirty , thirty five , hey , when did your mother go into menopause ?
penny Okay , I 'm not talking about this with you .

sheldon_cooper Oh , Penny , this is a natural human process , and we 're talking about statistically significant savings . Now , if you assume 15 tampons per cycle and a 28 day cycle , are you fairly regular ? Okay , no warehouse store , but we 're still on for put - put golf , right ?
leonard_hofstadter Hey , I just ran into Penny , she seemed upset about something .
sheldon_cooper I think it 's her time of the month . I marked the calendar for future reference .
leonard_hofstadter What 's with the fish ?
sheldon_cooper It 's an experiment .
leonard_hofstadter What happened to your scrambled egg research ?
sheldon_cooper Oh , that was a dead end . Scrambled eggs are as good as they 're ever going to be .
leonard_hofstadter So ... fish .
sheldon_cooper I read an article about Japanese scientists , who inserted DNA from luminous jellyfish into other animals , and I thought hey , fish nightlights .
leonard_hofstadter Fish nightlights .
sheldon_cooper It 's a billion dollar idea . Shhhhh !
leonard_hofstadter Mum 's the word . Sheldon , are you sure you do n't want to just apologize to Gablehauser and get your job back .
sheldon_cooper Oh , no , no , no . No , I 've too much to do .
leonard_hofstadter Like luminous fish .
sheldon_cooper Shhhhh !
leonard_hofstadter Right ... . I did n't ... .
sheldon_cooper That 's just the beginning . I also have an idea for a bulk mail - order feminine hygiene company . Oh , glow in the dark tampons ! Leonard , we 're going to be rich .
leonard_hofstadter Thank you for coming on such short notice .
mary_cooper You did the right thing calling .
leonard_hofstadter I did n't know what else to do , he 's lost all focus , every day he 's got a new obsession . This is a particularly disturbing one .
sheldon_cooper Mommy .
mary_cooper Hi baby .
sheldon_cooper You called my mother ?
mary_cooper Oh , you got yourself a loom , how nice .
sheldon_cooper Thank you .
mary_cooper Honey , why did you get a loom ?
sheldon_cooper I was working with luminous fish , and I thought , hey , loom ! Mom , what are you doing here ?
mary_cooper Leonard called me .
sheldon_cooper I know , but why ?
leonard_hofstadter Because one of the great minds of the twenty - first century is raising glow - in - the - dark fish and weaving sarapes .
sheldon_cooper This is not a sarape . This is a poncho . A sarape is open at the sides , a poncho is closed , this is a poncho , and neither is a reason to call someone 's mother .
leonard_hofstadter Really , when was the last time you left the house .
sheldon_cooper I went to the market with Penny .
leonard_hofstadter That was three weeks ago .
sheldon_cooper Well then buckle up , in the next four to eight days she 's going to get very crabby .
mary_cooper Sweetheart , your little friend is concerned about you .
sheldon_cooper Yes , well I 'm not a child , I 'm a grown man capable of living my life as I see fit . And I certainly do n't need someone telling on me to my mother .
leonard_hofstadter Where are you going ?
sheldon_cooper To my room , and no - one 's allowed in .
mary_cooper He gets his temper from his daddy .
leonard_hofstadter Oh .
mary_cooper He 's got my eyes .
leonard_hofstadter I see .
mary_cooper All that science stuff , that comes from Jesus .
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon ? Your mom made dinner .
sheldon_cooper I 'm not hungry .
mary_cooper Oh , Leonard , do n't trouble yourself , he 's stubborn . He may stay in there ' til the Rapture .
penny Are we so sure that 's a bad thing ?
mary_cooper I 'll tell ya , I love the boy to death , but he has been difficult since he fell out of me at the K - Mart .
howard_wolowitz Excuse me for being so bold , but I now see where Sheldon gets his smouldering good looks .

mary_cooper Oh , honey that ai n't going to work , but you keep trying . I made chicken , I hope that is n't one of the animals that you people think is magic ? You know , we have an Indian gentleman at our church , a Dr Patel , it 's a beautiful story , the lord spoke to him , and moved him to give us all 20 % off on lasic , you know , those that needed it .
leonard_hofstadter That is a lovely story , um , are we going to do anything about Sheldon ?
mary_cooper Oh , we will , you have to take your time with Sheldon . His father , God rest his soul , used to say to me , Mary , you have to take your time with Sheldon .
leonard_hofstadter Sounds like a wise man .
mary_cooper Oh , not so wise , he was trying to fight a bobcat for some licquorish . So , everybody grab a plate , and a pretty place mat that Shelly wove .
penny Has Shelly ever freaked out like this before .

mary_cooper Oh , all the time , I remember one summer when he was thirteen , he built a small nuclear reactor in the shed and told everybody he was going to provide free electricity for the whole town , well the only problem was he had no , whatchacall , fissionable materials . Anyway , when he went on the internets to get some , a man from the government came by and sat him down real gentle and told him it 's against the law to have yellow cake uranium in a shed .
penny What happened ?
mary_cooper Well , the poor boy had a fit , locked himself in his room and built a sonic death ray .
leonard_hofstadter A death ray ?
mary_cooper Well , that 's what he called it , did n't even slow down the neighbor kids . It pissed our dog off to no end . You know , you two make a cute couple .
leonard_hofstadter No , we 're not , we 're not , not a couple , two singles , like those individually wrapped slices of cheese that ... are friends .
mary_cooper Did I pluck a nerve there ?
howard_wolowitz Oh yeah .

mary_cooper Okay . Alright everybody , it 's time to eat . Oh Lord , we thank you for this meal , all your bounty , and we pray that you help Sheldon get back on his rocker . Now after a moment of silent meditation I 'm going to end with ' In Jesus ' Name ' but you two do n't feel any obligation to join in . Unless , of course , the holy spirit moves you .
penny Oh my God , this is the best cobbler I 've ever had .
mary_cooper It was always Sheldon ' s favorite . You know what the secret ingredient is ?
penny Love ?
mary_cooper Lard .
howard_wolowitz Hey , look who 's come out ... .
mary_cooper Shhh ! You 'll spook him . He 's like a baby deer , you got ta let him come to you .
leonard_hofstadter This is ridiculous . Dammit , Sheldon , snap out of it . You 're a physicist , you belong at the University doing research , not hiding in your room .
mary_cooper You do n't hunt , do you ?
mary_cooper Good morning , snicker - doodle .
sheldon_cooper Morning .
mary_cooper Oh , well that looks awful fancy , what is that ?
sheldon_cooper It 's my idea of what DNA would look like in a silicon based life form .
mary_cooper But intelligently designed by a creator , right ?
sheldon_cooper What do you want , mom ?
mary_cooper You know how your daddy used to say that you can only fish for so long before you got to throw a stick of dynamite in the water ?
sheldon_cooper Yeah .
mary_cooper Well , I 'm done fishing . You put those on .
sheldon_cooper What for ?
mary_cooper Because you 're going to go down to your office , you 're going to apologize to your boss , and get your job back .
sheldon_cooper No .
mary_cooper I 'm sorry , did I start that sentence with the words ' if it please your highness ? '
sheldon_cooper I 'm not going to apologize , I did n't say anything that was n't true .
mary_cooper Now you listen here , I have been telling you since you were four years old , it 's okay to be smarter than everybody but you ca n't go around pointing it out .
sheldon_cooper Why not ?
mary_cooper Because people do n't like it . Remember all the ass - kickings you got from the neighbor kids ? Now let 's get cracking . Shower , shirt , shoes , and let 's shove off .
sheldon_cooper Would n't have been any ass - kickings if that stupid death ray had worked .
mary_cooper Problem solved .
leonard_hofstadter Really ? That 's impressive .
mary_cooper Leonard , the Lord never gives us more than we can handle . Thankfully he blessed me with two other children who are dumb as soup .
mary_cooper Excuse me , Dr Gablehouser , are you busy ?
dr_eric_gablehauser Well , actually ... .
mary_cooper Sheldon , he 's just doodling , get in here .
sheldon_cooper Dr Gablehouser .
dr_eric_gablehauser Dr Cooper .
mary_cooper Let 's go , baby , we 're losing daylight .

sheldon_cooper Um , as you know , several weeks ago in our first encounter we may have gotten off on the wrong foot , when I called you an idiot . And I just wanted to say that I was wrong . To point it out .
dr_eric_gablehauser I 'm sorry , we have n't been introduced . Dr Eric Gablehouser .
mary_cooper Mary Cooper , Sheldon 's mom .
dr_eric_gablehauser Now that 's impossible , you must have had him when you were a teenager .
mary_cooper Oh , are n't you sweet , his father 's dead .
dr_eric_gablehauser Recently ?
mary_cooper Long enough .
dr_eric_gablehauser Please . Sheldon , should n't you be working ?
sheldon_cooper Okay .
leonard_hofstadter Hey , how did it go ?
sheldon_cooper I got my job back .
leonard_hofstadter Really ? What happened ?
sheldon_cooper I 'm not quite sure . It involves a part of the human experience that has always eluded me .
leonard_hofstadter That narrows it down .
mary_cooper I 'm very proud of you honey , you showed a lot of courage today .
sheldon_cooper Thanks , mom . Mom ?
mary_cooper Mmm - hmm ?
sheldon_cooper Is Dr Gablehouser going to be my new daddy ?
mary_cooper We 'll see . Sleep tight .
